availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter Cunningham Bailey (Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Garrard County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Desdemonia Nichols in Shelby County, Kentucky, on November 4, 1830. Father of Adelia Bailey, Isabella Bailey, John Steele Bailey, William T. Bailey, and Elizabeth Bailey. Merchant in Garrard County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Garrard County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Garrard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Division 1, p. 266B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 640.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 21.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259285, p. 1001.
Find A Grave, "Walter C. Bailey (1808-1885)," Memorial #28226187, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28226187 (accessed April 16, 2020).
North American Family Histories, 1500-2000, Provo, UT, Lineage Book, Daughters of the American Revolution, Vol. 95, 1912, p. 243.
